meanings.definition: To tie or fasten a knot in something that has already been knotted.
meanings.sent1: She carefully reknotted the rope to make sure it was secure.
meanings.sent2: He always reknots his shoelaces to prevent them from coming undone.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried reknotting its tail, thinking it was a new game.
meanings.sent4: The friendship between them was like reknotting a bond that had loosened over time.
meanings.sent5: The magician amazed the audience by reknotting a rope that had been cut in half.

meanings.definition: The act of tying a knot again in something that has come undone.
meanings.sent1: After the storm, the sailor's reknotting of the sails was crucial for their journey.
meanings.sent2: She learned the art of reknotting from her grandmother, who was a skilled seamstress.
meanings.sent3: The reknotting of the balloon string saved the day at the birthday party.
meanings.sent4: The reknotting of the thread symbolized the repair of their broken relationship.
meanings.sent5: The reknotting of the necklace added a unique touch to her jewelry collection.
